docs.snippet: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 17 (AP)-- Ed Furgol and Jackie Burke remained tied for the lead after thirty-six holes in the $35,000 Milwaukee open golf tournament today with 129's, eleven under par.
docs.lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 17 (AP)-- Ed Furgol and Jackie Burke remained tied for the lead after thirty-six holes in the $35,000 Milwaukee open golf tournament today with 129's, eleven under par.

headline.main: Ed Furgol and Burke Tied for Lead in $35,000 Milwaukee Open With 129's; EACH SHOOTS A 66 ON TRIPOLI LINKS Ed Furgol and Burke Lead Casper by 3 Shots--Fay Crocker First on 141 Furgol Posts 34, 32 Miss Faulk Second

docs.snippet: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 18 (AP)--Joyce Ziske of Waterford, Wis., steadily gaining confidence in her second pro season, equalled men's par today to take the lead after three rounds in the $5,000 Norwood Hills women's invitation golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 18 (AP)--Joyce Ziske of Waterford, Wis., steadily gaining confidence in her second pro season, equalled men's par today to take the lead after three rounds in the $5,000 Norwood Hills women's invitation golf tournament.

headline.main: JOYCE ZISKE TAKES LINKS LEAD ON 218

docs.snippet: The names of thirteen LatinAmerican journalists who will participate in a two-month seminar in the United States were announced last week by the American Press Institute.
docs.lead_paragraph: The names of thirteen LatinAmerican journalists who will participate in a two-month seminar in the United States were announced last week by the American Press Institute.
docs.abstract: 13 Latin-Amer newsmen to attend Amer Press Inst seminar, NYC; list; conf backed by Ford and Rockefeller Foundation grants

headline.main: 13 LATIN NEWSMEN DUE AT SEMINAR; Ford and Rockefeller Funds Aid Two-Month Program Opening Here Sept. 7

docs.snippet: Tax competition, like price competition, now extends around the world. American corporations and--to a smaller extent-- individual are rushing to found companies abroad. Great tax savings are possible.
docs.lead_paragraph: Tax competition, like price competition, now extends around the world. American corporations and--to a smaller extent-- individual are rushing to found companies abroad. Great tax savings are possible.
docs.abstract: Comment on US corps rush to set up subsidiaries in foreign 'tax havens' to avoid double taxation of profits; techniques described; examples; some 30 'havens' exist; tax laws in many of them cited; J S Seidman comments

headline.main: TAX HAVENS DRAW MANY COMPANIES; U.S. Corporations and Some Individuals Rush to Set Up Concerns Abroad Fees May Be Charged TAX HAVENS DRAW MANY COMPANIES Help for Individuals No Tax in Bahamas More Tax Havens

docs.snippet: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 19 (U.P.)--Fay Crocker of Montevideo, Uruguay, carded a 68 today to win the Norwood Hills women's open golf tournament. Her 288 for the 72-hole event was worth $880.
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 19 (U.P.)--Fay Crocker of Montevideo, Uruguay, carded a 68 today to win the Norwood Hills women's open golf tournament. Her 288 for the 72-hole event was worth $880.

headline.main: JUAN J. AMEZAGA OF URUGUAY DIES; President, 1943-47, Served as a Law Professor and an Envoy to League of Nations For United Nations Idea

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 22-- The Soviet Union's most successful battle in its campaign for repatriating former Eastern Europeans has ended, a well informed source disclosed today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 22-- The Soviet Union's most successful battle in its campaign for repatriating former Eastern Europeans has ended, a well informed source disclosed today.
docs.abstract: USSR diplomats reptd ordered to end drive to repatriate ex-natls; USSR spokesman, Buenos Aires, denies drive was instigated but confirms no more repatriation ships will sail; Argentine press features story of Lewschuk girl's desertion at Genoa

headline.main: ARGENTINES' EXIT TO SOVIET ENDING; Soviet Aide Confirms Halt in Movement but Denies Moscow Directed It

byline.original: By EDWARD A. MORROW Special to The New York Times

headline.main: SHIPPING--MAILS; ALL HOURS GIVEN IN DAYLIGHT SAVING TIME.
